column4: How do I make apt-get ignore a specific dependency when installing a package?
I don't think you can do that, but you can do it manually with dpkg
note that doing it may break your system.
wouldn't the worst case be breaking the package I'm installing with missing dependancies?
It might confuse apt.
what package is it, though?
I want to install wine without installing libgphoto2-2, or install libgphoto2-2 without installing udev.
you... don't have udev installed?
or is it trying to dl udev from a non-ubuntu repository?
It's on colinux.  All the stuff that interacts directly with hardware can't be installed.
ah
download the libgphoto package manually.
then you need to install it with dpkg and the appropriate --force -flags
can I make apt-get download the deb without thinking about dependancies?
apt-get -d install libgphoto2-2
it refuses to download the deb because of dependancy handling.
ah, aptitude can do it
aptitude download whatever
thanks.  I'll have to install aptitude, but if it works, it works
then you can install the libgphoto thing with dpkg -i libgphoto*deb --ignore-depends=udev
thanks, it's working.
